  • Innovate:¬†Stay ahead of the curve by researching, testing, and recommending the best tools and frameworks. Champion strong data governance practices, ensuring data security and compliance.

Who You Are:

  • Possess a deep understanding of data architecture principles, designing and implementing efficient and scalable solutions.
  • Thrive in sharing your passion for data, empowering others to learn and grow. Be a contagious source of knowledge.
  • Stay at the forefront of data innovation, constantly researching and exploring new technologies and trends to bring back to your team.

Ready to build the future of data-driven success? Apply now.

Senior Data Engineer

Scala, Python, Java, Apache Kafka, Spark, AWS

Up to ¬£90k

London (min. 2 times per month)

Use your skills to change the world through data.

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineers to join a global project with far-reaching impacts. Now more than ever we need Data-Driven decision making to help reduce our impact on the planet.

You will be building scalable pipelines that ensure high quality data arrives in the right places.

The Successful Data Engineer will need:

  • Experience designing, planning and productionising scalable data infrastructure
  • Proficiency with at least one of Python, Scala or Java, as well as advanced SQL knowledge
  • Experience building batch and realtime streaming data pipelines
  • Capable of designing and implementing modern data solutions using AWS

Work Style: Hybrid-Remote
Location:¬†Central London

Posted:¬†Thursday 16th November 2023

Are you an advanced subject matter expert in data science looking to drive continuous improvement and development through your technical and leadership abilities? Keep reading.

This role would put you in the middle of an FTSE top 15 energy company undergoing a major digital transformation focussed on helping them meet their pledge of going carbon neutral by 2050. This role allows you to utilise your¬†Python¬†programming skills and help develop a wider team of data scientists.

Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Lead, grow and develop a team of data scientists that derives actionable business insights from data.
  • Advocate for and ensure your team adheres to data science standard processes.
  • Responsible for deploying secure and well-tested software that meets privacy and compliance requirements.

I’ve partnered with a leading insurtech company in searching for a Senior Data Engineer to work in their growing data function. Their new focus on becoming a product-led business means that you can use your experience in building out data platforms and working on replacing legacy systems in AWS to help this growing company with their long term vision!

This role will see you working in a team of 7, closely collaborating with the Data Architect to ensure a successful migration and maintain the high standards within the team going forward.

Skills Required:

  • AWS
  • Java or Python
  • Modern data solutions (e.g. PySpark, Kafka, Airflow, Scala)

Important details:

  • Up to ¬£90,000 per year (with a 10% bonus)
  • Hybrid working (2-3 times per month in a Central London office)
  • 3 stage interview process

Interested, or know someone who would be? Click apply, or get in touch directly on mgojzewski@trg-uk.com

Take a massive oil company and turn it into a carbon neutral company. Impossible, right? How does data engineering help fight against the biggest threat the world is facing?

By being data driven and taking a progressive approach with some of leading figures straight out of Silicon Valley using hypothesis driven development, AB testing and only the highest standards of data engineering, can a huge complex business like this transform itself inside out.

We’re therefore looking for strong data engineers with strong objected oriented programming skills to work on something truly globally impactful.

Are you a software engineer who has worked in data heavy environments? This is a great opportunity for you also!

Desired skills:

  • 4+ years of working with scalable systems and data products in complex, cloud environments (AWS or Azure
  • Strong development experience in object-oriented languages (Python, Go, Java, C++)
  • Strong fundamental knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems

Other details:

  • Hybrid (3 days per week in Central London office)
  • TC up to ~ ¬£120,000 (inc. basic salary, bonuses, benefits)
  • 3 stage interview process with technical coding assessments

This is just the tip of the iceberg, so if you would like to learn more about this job opportunity then click apply or contact me directly on mgojzewski@trg-uk.com

Industry- Energy

Working Policy- Hybrid 2/3 days a week in Central London

Interview process- 3 stages

Permanent- Starting as soon as possible

Staff Data Engineer

Are you looking for a progressive environment, on its way to establishing itself at the forefront of green business solutions ?

Are you looking to lead a team working with complex data problems on modern tech?

We are looking for a Staff Data Engineer to join a team within the energy industry. In this new role you will be focussing on complex data based problems. You will be working as part of global company utilising data lakes/ ADF to ensure optimum, modern data solutions are implemented.

You will be relying heavily on your previous 3+ years experience with Azure for the technical aspects of the role working mainly as an IC. Whilst also leading, growing and developing a team of data engineers that writes, deploys and maintains software to build, integrate, manage, maintain, and quality-assure data.
